definitions.definition: To do something harmful or negative to get revenge for some harm; to fight back or respond in kind to an injury or affront .
examples: John insulted Peter to retaliate for Peter's acid remark earlier.
Many companies have policies in place to prevent bosses from retaliating against allegations of harassment.

definitions.definition: To repay or requite by an act of the same kind.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To do something harmful or negative to get revenge for some harm; to fight back or respond in kind to an injury or affront .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To repay or requite by an act of the same kind.
